courses.name: The Foundations of the United States Air Force
courses.description: Introduces the Air Force and Air Force ROTC. Topics include professional appearance, military customs and courtesies, core values, equal opportunity and treatment, officer opportunities, group leadership problems. Applies communicative skills. Leadership lab.

courses.name: The Foundations of the United States Air Force
courses.description: Continues the introduction to the Air Force and Air Force ROTC. Topics include Air Force origins, organizations, major commands, installations, sister services (Army and Navy), group leadership problems. Applies communicative skills. Leadership lab.

courses.name: The Evolution of USAF Air and Space Power
courses.description: A survey course designed to facilitate the transition from Air Force ROTC cadet to Air Force ROTC officer candidate. Explores Air Force heritage, Air Force leaders and Air Power doctrine.  Applies communicative skills. Leadership lab.

courses.name: The Evolution of USAF Air and Space Power
courses.description: Continues the examination of air and space power from the Vietnam era through the present.  Topics include the Vietnam War, the Persian Gulf War, and overseas contingency operations. Applies communicative skills. Leadership lab.

courses.name: Air Force Leadership Studies
courses.description: An integrated leadership and management survey course emphasizing development of the individual as an Air Force leader. Special topics include situational leadership, principle centered leadership, corrective supervision and counseling. Leadership lab.

courses.name: Air Force Leadership Studies
courses.description: Air Force leadership principles are examined from the foundation developed in AEROÂ 3100.  Ethical decision making, personal core values, and character development are discussed.  Military evaluation systems are outlined.  Leadership lab.

courses.name: National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty
courses.description: Examines the national security process, regional studies, Air Force and joint doctrine.  Special topics include the military as a profession and civilian control of the military.  Continued emphasis on communicative skills. Leadership lab.

courses.name: National Security Affairs/Preparation for Active Duty
courses.description: Examines civilian control of the military, officership, the military justice system, and current issues affecting military professionalism. Continued refinement of communicative skills. Leadership laboratory.
